task.title: Disabling a destination mapping rule by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can disable a destination mapping rule by using the update DestinationMappingRule command with the Enabled=False flag.

taskbody.context: You can disable a destination mapping rule by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to disable a destination mapping rule, see .Disabling a destination mapping rule stops the rule, which might result in the loss of messages.

step.cmd: To disable a destination mapping rule, enter the following command:
step.info:
It is necessary to capitalize each command parameter, and to use the double quotation marks as shown.
update DestinationMappingRule "Name=DMRname" "Enabled=False"Where:
DMRname Specifies the name of the destination mapping rule you want to disable.

taskbody.example: This example demonstrates disabling a destination mapping rule called exampleRule. update DestinationMappingRule "Name=exampleRule" "Enabled=False" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
